title: Ed McCrillis
text: Edgar Vincent Frederick McCrillis (September 7, 1904 – September 1, 1940) was a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player who spent two seasons in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> with the <a href="Providence%20Steam%20Roller">Providence Steam Roller</a>, in 1926, and the <a href="Boston%20Bulldogs%20%28NFL%29">Boston Bulldogs</a> in 1929. Prior to playing professional football, Ed played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Brown%20University">Brown University</a>. He was later selected for Brown's All-Decade Team (1920–1929).
